ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1-2 hrs/week
2-3 hours
3 hours/week

I used to spend 6 t0 8 hours reading the text book and articles ahead of the weekly lecture. Also, I used to revise most of the previous lectures make myself ready for the surprise quizzes every week.
4 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Great introduction to occupational health and hazards! Great guest speakers. Readings were manageable - but wish they were provided a slightly bit more in advance.
The course was a great introduction to occupational medicine. It was extremely interesting and the guest lecturers were a great change of pace.

The course was excellent. I have decided to do fellowship in occupational and environmental medicine after doing my residency for the future. It was very practical and engaging. I am excited to take the course from people with diverse and practical experience in the field.The reference text book was complete and very informative too.

This was a really interesting and enjoyable course. I learned a lot at each lecture, both when Carrie or Meredith was lecturing and when one of the fabulous guest lecturers was visiting. The course could be improved from using better and more reliable computer equipment in the occ med room.

Very fair to good introduction to Occupational and Environmental Medicine. Broad but engaging and certainly informative. Strengths: Instructors, guest lecturers, readings, text-book (somewhat), Weakness: size and configuration of room; technological, limitations. Recommendation: more pre-planned group exercises based on readings

I thought this was a great course. Every week there is a guest lecturer who talks about different areas in the field of occupational health, and gives you a very good overview of the subject. The workload was very light, although there are pop quizzes.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Very knowledgeable and asks the class thought provoking questions.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Great!
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Very knowledgeable and captivating lecturer

Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Dr. Redlich was an excellent instructor. Her lectures were very practical. I liked her practical comments in every lecture. I could see the complexity of the field and the challenges in the real world. The articles she was choosing for the classes were awesome.

Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Knowledgeable and Intelligent. Willing to engage, support and challenge. A bit intense but with the best intention and a wealth of experience that she is willing to share. provide feedback.

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Loved Prof. Stowe! She's knowledgeable, approachable, and helpful in getting us to understand the material as well as accommodating special requests for materials in advance. She seems to really care about her students.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Great!
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Great instructor and very willing to help students out

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Dr. Stowe was with us during every single lecture the whole semester. In fact, it was a privilege for us to have her with us all the time. Her lecture was very engaging and practical. The surprise quizzes were smart ideas which were making us revise all the lectures ahead of each class. she always wanted us to see instruments used in occupational and environmental medicine. I liked her practical questions on the different approaches of researches in the field.

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Very, knowledgeable, Intelligent, capable and encouraging. Willing to engage, support and challenge. More focused on educating than assessing which allows for students to address mistakes without being too concerned about harsh evaluation or heavy judgement.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Dr. Stowe was a wonderful instructor for this course. She is very approachable and knowledgeable about the field.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great intro course! The workload is very manageable and the topics are very interesting. I would definitely recommend this course to another student.
I recommend this course.
This course far exceeded my expectations. It is a relevant to clinicians in every discipline.
Despite the 8am start, the course was interesting, unique and i highly recommend taking it.
Yes i would recommend very good at teachu=ing the basics of envirinmental and occ medicine

I strongly recommend this class for medical students and for people practicing medicine. I can say we hardly know anything regarding occupational and environmental medicine. A lot of the occupational diseases are underdiagnosed or misdiagnosed. We see a lot of patients with complaints regarding social security benefits, work place injuries, etc. Do we really know how to address such issues? then I tell them to sign up for this class. It really helps for everyday medical practice.

This was a really enjoyable and informative course that I highly recommend to YSPH students. Great instructors, engaging guest lecturers, and small class size. Really enjoyed the class and everyone involved in organizing it.

Very fair to good introduction to Occupational and Environmental Medicine. Broad but engaging and certainly informative. Accommodating of even the uninitiated re: environmental and occupational health.
I would highly recommend this course to anyone who is interested in issues concerning occupational safety and health.
